oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On Free-Edge Effect and Onset of Delamination in FRPC Laminates Using Mixed Finite Element Model
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAMTEKKAR, GS
DESAI, YM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: composite
extension
strength
delamination
free-edge effect
mixed fem
failure theories
tensor polynomial failure criterion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Free-edge stress analysis and the onset of delamination at the free-edges of FRPC laminates have been studied in the present paper. The stress analysis has been performed using a layer-wise 3-D mixed finite element model developed by the authors. Because the mixed FE formulation appropriately models the kinetics and the kinematics of laminated structures, the high stress gradients at the free-edge region of composite laminates have been appositely mapped. The onset of delamination failure has been computed using the tensor polynomial (quadratic) failure criterion. Results have been compared with the theoretical and experimental results available in the literature. It has been shown that the present results are in good agreement with the experimental observations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF REINFORCED PLASTICS AND COMPOSITES, 28(3), 317-341
